title: MasterChef's Matt Preston and Gary Mehigan to 'launch new show WITHOUT George Calombaris' on Seven
text:
Axed MasterChef judges Matt Preston and Gary Mehigan are reportedly 'cooking up a new show with Seven', without George Calombaris.

According to The Herald Sun on Saturday, Seven West Media's new CEO James Warburton is hoping Matt and Gary can 'reinvigorate' the network.

An insider claimed to the publication that George was 'left off the list' after admitting to underpaying staff at his Melbourne restaurants nearly $8 million.

Drama! Axed MasterChef judges Matt Preston (centre) and Gary Mehigan (left) are tipped to be working on a rival cooking show with Seven, without George Calombaris (right)

Matt, Gary and George were all ousted from MasterChef in July after contract negotiations stalled, after ten years on the show.

Last week, Channel 10 confirmed the new judges on MasterChef Australia will be Andy Allen, Melissa Leong and Jock Zonfrillo.

It is said Matt and Gary's alleged new venture with Seven will be announced at the network's Upfronts 2020 event in Sydney on Wednesday.

What will happen? According to The Herald Sun on Saturday, Seven West Media's new CEO James Warburton is hoping Matt (right) and Gary (left) can 'reinvigorate' the network

Scandal: An insider claimed to the publication that George (pictured) was 'left off the list' after admitting to underpaying staff at his Melbourne restaurants nearly $8 million

Speaking to the Sydney Morning Herald in August, Gary admitted their MasterChef exit came as their contracts did not allow them freedom to expand their brand.

'All the financial terms had been agreed; it was purely about the length of the new contract. We wanted to keep making [MasterChef],' he said.

'But we needed space to stretch our legs and do our own thing... [the contract from Ten] would have limited our ability to do other things.'

Announcement! Last week, Channel 10 confirmed the new judges on MasterChef Australia will be Andy Allen (left), Melissa Leong (centre) and Jock Zonfrillo (right)

Matt, Gary and George established a production company together in February.

Since launching in 2009, MasterChef Australia has often proved even more popular overseas, with huge opportunities available now for the judges globally.

The program reaches perhaps its biggest audience in India.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Seven for comment.
description: Axed MasterChef judges Matt Preston and Gary Mehigan are reportedly 'cooking up a new show with Seven', without George Calombaris.
authors: Joshua Fox For Daily Mail Australia
